Butter Chicken: They do a classic like it should be done. They don't try to do too much with it. It is just right and exactly what you expect from it.

Finally, Drinks:
Mango Mule: Hands down my favorite here...

Overall, coming here with friends is always a good idea and a fun time.
author: Nipun S.

description:
I wanted to like the place given that it is 2 blocks from where I live. We went for the happy hour to give the place a try before plunging into a full fledged dinner. Being an Indian, I'm always looking for a burst of flavors in my food and believe me it is difficult to make bland indian food. But the place managed to do just that. Everything we had lacked flavors and the portions were extremely small. Also, as the happy hour menu was very limited, we ended up ordering from the regular menu, but all 3 dishes failed to impress. The less I say about the drinks the better. They were watered down and the place is trying too hard to infuse an Indian touch in their drinks. It's not modern Indian food, it's tasteless food which had an Indian look to it.

Lastly about the service, so that's what led to the merger 2 stars. Most of the times people coming in for happy hour are generally trying the place and deciding if they'd like to come back and if they get bad service at that time, you've lost future customers. So I'd definitely want to urge the bartender and the other service staff to not treat hh customers like second grade, because nothing irritates customers more than bad service. Also, you ask before you pick someone's plate. They picked up my plate while I was still eating out of it and when I asked them to give me some extra chutney they charged me for it. All in all, I regret going there and came out agitated on a Friday evening. It's far away from being either of the things it claims to be. Neither do you get fine dining nor quality Indian food.
author: Isha R.

description:
Absolutely delicious! The spin they have put on traditional Indian dishes enhance the authentic flavors. My family has always been fan of fusion flavors and we absolutely loved the innovative fusion at rooh. 

I celebrated my birthday with my parents and husband at rooh last weekend. We tried everything vegetarian as my parents are strict vegetarians.We ordered: dahi puri, beet murabba, pumpkin mulligatawny, potato tikki, paneer pinwheel and grain and vegetables pulao. For dessert we had carrot halva cake and some coconut cake. Their cocktails and mocktails were amazing as well.  

Staff was very courteous and cared deeply about our experience! We will visit rooh again to try non-vegetarian dishes as well.
author: Niti P.

description: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars. The food is amazing!!! So so good. So unique. So creative. But the service leaves a lot to ask for. Went there to celebrate a birthday. Ordered the Dahi poori, asparagus and paneer pinwheel. All the food was great. But we had to wait for an hour for our entree. To wait that long in a restaurant which was not that crowded in San Francisco, where I'm paying 25 bucks a pop is UNACCEPTABLE. Do not go here if you have plans after. Definitely go here if you have time to spare. No complains on the food. It's super delicious and authentic.
author: Ashmita V.

description:
This is just a one time deal - service was awful, our waitress would say she's coming right back with the dinner menu and then never show up so we had to flag someone else.  After the order has been placed and I can clearly see that the person who took our order went over to have a word with the waitress, she came by a few minutes later surprised that we had already ordered.  

Word to restaurant - if you are trying to pull of a great dining experience you need to hire accordingly, have someone actually manage the floor and train people well.

Food is expensive, some hits and misses,  the showmanship of pouring the sauce onto the entree really got old after the second dish.  Not as innovative as they make themselves out to be. Limited menu.
author: Anon P.

description:
Over the years, I feel like my taste has gotten even more discriminating, probably one too many Michelin star restaurants. Going up in a great foodie family, I am particularly severe on Indian restaurants. Either they tend to be nice and simple South Indian cooking, or the usual North Indian greasy fare. Its hard for them to be special and make a mark.

From that perspective, Rooh just blew us away. The food was exotic while straying not far from its Indian roots. We went in for brunch on a Saturday with moderate expectations. CC, the waiter was very attentive, moved us from a drafty corner to a nice place. She recommended the cauliflower koliwada as a starter. We also ordered the Salli Par Eedu. While the Salli Par Eedu was fairly middle of the road, the cauliflower koliwada was an outstanding dish. Never enjoyed cauliflower that much! 

The main dishes were Green Pea and Goat Cheese Kulcha. This was executed well. It came with an accompaniment of Choley which reminded of the exact same thing my Mom made. The desserts simply blew us away. We had a chance to spend time with Chef Pujan Sarkar who was kind enough to talk to us and treated us to a dessert sampler.

The Phirni Mousse Cashew Cake with the Thandai Ice Cream, followed by Spiced Chocolate Pave with Salted jaggery Ice Cream were simply to die for. Each one was specially hand made by the Chef after we placed the order. We finally had a chance to try the bomb "Fermented Turmeric Sorbet", molecular gastronomy without straying from its Indian roots. Truly a work of art!

Mark my words, Pujan Sarkar is going to be a superstar amongst Indian Chefs. Of late I have tried many top Indian restaurants in the Bay Area by top Indian chefs including Amber, August 15, Sakoon, Yellow Chilli etc. Rooh is a cut above them all. 

Pujan Sarkar truly makes it special. Can't wait to go back for dinner.
author: Runip G.

description:
Perhaps my favourite fancy Indian place in San Francisco. I took my mom to Rooh for dinner for her last night in SF, and boy was it worth it! Everything on the menu is an interesting twist on modern Indian food. The menu is limited but we loved whatever we ordered. The place gets pretty busy; thankfully, we got reservations through Yelp

We started with the Chutney Sampler and the Potato Tikki, both very good. The sampler was very filling- look out for the cheese and chili stuffed naan, it's delish! For our mains, we got the aubergines with some naan, a stuffed eggplant curry dish, heavily loaded with peanuts. The stuffing and the curry were both rather spicy, and I probably will not be getting it again. A MUST have is the garlic and avocado raita- I cannot describe how wonderful the creamy yoghurt in it is! 

For dessert, we got the Malai Tart- creamy, crumbly, spiced deliciousness. 

The service was very good as well. All in all, I cannot wait to go back!
author: Surashree K.

description:
I am Indian and I know the right standards of good Indian food. We went to Rooh last week and the food was delicious. I ordered all the vegetarian dishes and they were good! 

Ordered Dahi puri and chilipaneer for appetizers and I must say I never ever had avacado in dahi puri and I tasted the best to put in it.

Main course curries were mouth watering too.
author: Garima K.

description: One of the Indian fine dining option in SF. The ambience was very nice. I ordered Aalo tikki and dahi poori as starters, they couldn't be any better. In main course we had lamb shank nihari. It was very well cooked and tasty. Service was good. We had to wait for 10 mins to get the table. I would suggest to make a reservation.
author: Salman M.

description:
Fantastic... Drinks and Appetizers 
Beautiful Ambiance and Presentation 
Pleasing Staff
author: Deepak K.

description: This is now one of my favourite restaurant in the Bay area for Indian food. The service is top notch, ambience is really nice and food is the best ever!! Being vegetarian, we ordered the cauliflower koliwada and aloo tikki with spinach and kale pakoda. The cauliflower koliwada is a MUST try. For entree we ordered the paneer pinwheel with garlic naan. The makhani gravy was mind blowing. For dessert we had the cashew cake which was decent, will try something else the next time. Will definitely be coming back to this place again. Our server Nina was really nice and pleasant. Thank you for the amazing service!
author: Nibha K.

description: My wife & I had the vegetarian tasting menu which was incredibly good, creative & reasonable in price. The service from our waiter Chris was great. We are not only vegetarians but do not eat eggs & they accommodated us. They also have great mocktails. The restaurant is nicely decorated. Parking was not a problem (there was no SF Giants game though). If you want the tasting menu, note that when you make the reservation. Their regular menu, dessert menu, & brunch menu also look creative. There was enough energy in the restaurant to feel upbeat, but it was never loud enough to bother us.
author: Mihir M.

description:
Disappointing food and cocktails. I tried 3 cocktails and all were too sweet for my taste and lacked flavor depth. The fruit juices dominated even in the supposed astringent cocktails.

Had the asparagus fry, garlic naan, and the Dali puri. Sad to say I've had better and more flavorful in my small town. Not to mention tiny portions for $15/plate. I don't mind spending money on amazing food/ drink /ambiance but Rooh doesn't deliver.

I feel this restaurant has been overhyped. I'd been dying to go for months and unfortunately had high expectations based on yelp reviews and the awards they've received. 

The service was excellent so, there's that.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Met up a group of friends last week at ROOH before heading to the Giants game. I arrived on Wednesday, April 26th around 6:30pm. The majority of our group was already there, so they managed to grab two tables in the bar area. We ended up being a party of around 8, so we also had a few seats at the bar.

*CHUTNEY SAMPLER: with Garlic Naan, Green Pea & Goat Cheese Kulcha, Avocado & Yogurt, Chili & Peanut, Tomatillo & Green Mango ($12)
*TUNA BHEL: Avocado, Tamarind Gel, Puffed Black Rice, Baby Radish, Togarashi ($15)
*CHICKEN 65: Onion Uttapam, Sour Cream, Peanut Chutney, Podi Masala ($15)
*PORK BELLY: Sweet & Sour Mango Achar, Masala Cracklings, Green Onion ($15)
*Mustard Old Fashioned: Four Roses Whiskey, Mustard & Ghee Wash, Aromatic Bitters, Honey ($13)
*Oban 14 year ($18)

I was actually going to order the mustard old fashioned, but when everyone in my group said it was way too sweet, I ended up refraining. I think everyone said the honey overpowered everything. Instead, I just got an Oban 14. It was an average pour and priced normal for a higher end restaurant. In general, I thought the scotch whisky section of their spirits list was on the pricier side. I didn't try any of the food, but everyone who ate seemed to enjoy the dishes.

The restaurant itself is very nice, though I found the bar area a little cramped. Our tables were super close to the bar seating. I could sit at the bar and feel like it was still part of our party. Service was great. The servers were very attentive and nice. And they kept water coming which I appreciated.

I'd love to come back to take advantage of their happy hour specials. Until then, 3 stars for now.
author: Elena N.

description: Amazing decor, service and food. Nothin to say more. Always top notch no matter what you take. Desserts are amazing. The only down I'd say are cocktails which I'm not a fan of. But that's literally the only one. Highly recommend!
author: Ilona K.

description: Rooh is exquisite. I do not drink but my party had wonderful things to say about their drinks menu. They have creative names for the drinks that bring in the flavour of different parts of India. The food is very creative, innovative,  tasty, and new. The portions are small. One order would serve two people, who are not very hungry but this gives you an opportunity to order more of different dishes and try them. The gastronomical experience of this place is one of a kind and I would hightly recommend to try this place.
author: Premila M.

description: Food is really good. Loved the place. Specially there is lot  of parking available as well
author: Supratim M.

description:
Very sad to give this 2 star review. The food, as always, was very good. This time the service was terrible. We got in at 7pm, placed the order at 7:05. Our appetizers came in at 7:35, drinks came after the appetizer and they missed an order in our appetizer. The main course did not show up. At 8:15, they said 2-3 minutes. At 8:30, they said as soon as a minute. At 8:45, the manager finally said "it will take atleast 5 minutes and we dont know how long". We had to leave without food, luckily I had leftovers at home. The only person who showed some respect to our time was a waitress (not our waiter) who said "please dont give up on us, it has been a rough day at work and it wont happen again". 

To add insult to injury, they marked us as "table for 6" and added 20% gratuity. We were a table of four. I think I might give up on this place. If I am paying 50$ a meal, I expect to be treated with honesty.

Update : The restaurant reached out to me, I will give it another chance in the future because the food is great.
author: Balu V.

description: We dined and had a horrid experience! The manager fake reached out to us on yelp. I guess to show the yelp world they "follow up with there guests" only the catch is they never actually do!!!! Very embarrassing and shameful on their end will never be back! Sad the manager could not of handled this in a professional manner even after we filed a complaint.
author: Brittany C.

description:
Flavors are good at this high-end Indian restaurant. However, the butter chicken, which consisted of 3 measly pieces of chicken, certainly isn't worth the $26 price tag (and of course you need to add the $5-$8 nan and then you are in the $30+ range for this plate). I'd recommend getting an assortment of small plates instead, priced reasonably at $12-15, and for me, always end up tasting better and more interesting than main dishes. Definitely get the tuna bhel--it is a well balanced dish in both taste and texture. Potato tiki was beautiful and tasty. Skip the tasting platter -- as you can see the sausage have shrunk quite a bit since the opening.

How they price the menu confuses me--for whatever reason, the same plate would cost $15 during dinner but $16 for happy hour?? Now that certainly does not make me happy. 

With the too-constant water refills (I know, first world problems) and sometimes awkward service, the staff needs more training for this truly to be a fine dining destination.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
One of the best places to have flavorful and amazing food. 

If you are looking for a classy indian place for date night or just to enjoy with friends and family this is your place. 

Slightly expensive but totally worth it
author: Er Akshar J.

description:
What an inspiring culinary journey!  We came here for SF Restaurant Week and thoroughly enjoyed the creative artistry and inventive flavor combinations that went into the 5-course meal.  

Pani Puri
Notes: Exciting introduction to the meal.  The pop of tangy flavors from the spiced passionfruit water and tamarind were complemented nicely by the light, crisp puri.  

Course 1: Spiced Lentil Kulcha (we had this as an alternative to the Green Peas and Goat Cheese Kulcha option):
Notes: Great level of spice in the lentils and soft flavorful bread topped with winter truffle shavings.  Presentation was underwhelming but this was not an issue since the flavors were great.

Course 2: Potato Tikki
Notes: Flavors and textures of this dish were incredible.  The lightness of the crispy spinach and kale tempura couples nicely with the dense aloo tikki.  The addition of the creamy sweet and sour yogurt mousse and playfully scattered raspberry bits completed the dish.  


Course 3: Achari Monk Fish
Notes: Mildly spiced, coconut curry sauce paired incredibly well with the perfectly cooked monk fish (which had a tasty tandoori flavor).  The lemon foam added a nice cloud of zest to the dish.

Course 4: Traditional Butter Chicken
Notes: Chicken was beautifully cooked and perfectly moist.  The red pepper butter sauce was absolutely delectable.

Course 5: Masala Chai and Chocolate Pave
Notes: Intricate dish with an artistic presentation and intriguing flavors.  Masala chai flavor was not readily detectable; nevertheless, the combination of creamy, mousse-like chocolate, the splash of citrus provided by the orange murabba, the chocolate bits, and the ice cream made for a satisfying dessert.

Side: Garlic Naan
Notes: This dish tasted more like plain naan rather than garlic naan.  The bread itself was great but the lack of a prominent garlic flavor was somewhat disappointing. 

Also, I wish they served masala chai at dinner--it would have gone nicely with the dessert (we were told that it is only available during lunch).

Overall, this was a delightful dining experience.  The restaurant itself is trendy and eye-catching with the pop of electric blues, orange curtains, and colorful pillows.  Instrumental world music plays overhead, which helps to create a lively, lounge-like ambiance.  Service ran smoothly like a well-oiled machine (we were tended to by 7 different members of the staff who were attentive and maintained a nice pace with the courses).  Incredible tasting journey--will certainly return for the inventive flavors and captivating twist on Indian cuisine.
author: Kristyn H.

description: Randomly chose this place during restaurant week. We had the tasting menu, which was extensive and we were able to try many different flavors. Vegetarian options and meat lovers can indulge. The place is tastefully decorated and the food is even more beautiful. Presentation is everything and the staff is all warm smiles and service.
author: Sanaa H.

description: Great food and service. The jackfruit kofta topped with crisp lotus stem is outstanding and the chutney sampler with naan is a must-try as well. The chole with saffron rice is a combination that never disappoints. There could be more additions to the dessert menu though. It was my birthday dinner and it certainly did satiate my craving for some special Indian food. Thanks for an amazing time.
author: Wini V.

description:
After waiting to go there for months, finally got a reservation... that was quite an experience!! Food was Average - nothing exotic at all - very average selection of curries - matter of fact, almost everything tastes the same... the curries!!
The only thing that was different and good was the Bar Menu... their cocktails. Commendable!!
Service was friendly and staff was most helpful.
Not worth the money or the wait!!
author: Ravi J.

description:
I've never imagine how Indian cuisine could be so bougie! I came here with my friend because I won an Instagram giveaway for a dinner at ROOH for the special Diwali menu on 10/21/17. An amazing experience where my tongue was able to venture in zones I had never before seen. Everything was well spiced and flavored, and the sauces felt so life-changing!

Dranks/menu descriptions:
- Delhi 6 [wild turkey, rose shrub, elderflower, roohafza]: I really enjoyed this drink because it tasted like my favorite Taiwanese sour plums (酸梅). LOL It was weird having it in liquid form though, but very nicely balanced sweetness and tartness in this drink.
- Raspberry Shikanji [appleton estate rum, fresh raspberry, herbsutra]: Nice and safe choice because some of the other stuff on the cocktail menu look quite adventurous. Can't go wrong with raspberry.

What was eaten/menu descriptions:
- Dahi Puri [sweet & sour yogurt, avocado, tamarind gel]: honestly one of my favorites because the sweet & sour yogurt was so light yet subtle-ly flavorful
-Beetroot & Goat Cheese Chop (Croquette) [peanut, lemon, sour cream]: I didn't even notice that goat cheese was used, so it was great (I detest the strong goat cheese taste). Loved the crunchiness! Another solid starter.
-Tuna Bhel [avocado, tamarind gel, puffed black rice, green mango]: I loved the sauce in this one, and it was such a refreshing plate. Felt like I was eating an ahi salad, but with nice crunchy puffs.
-Duck Shikampuri [spiced huckleberry chutney, pickled radish]: I loved the presentation of this dish! The pickles as flower petals were a nice aesthetic touch. The duck mousse was delicious, especially with the huckleberry chutney -- which was the best part of the dish. I basically licked the chutney clean off the plate! Wish I could take home a jar of this!
-Cauliflower Koliwada [onion uttapam, wasabi sour cream, pickled ginger]: Another one of the highlights of this meal! The flavors in this one were definitely stronger than in other dishes, but if I recall correctly, I tasted all the colors of the rainbow~. The spiciness not at all apparent when you first take a bite, definitely lingers on in the aftertaste. Ugh, 10/10. The uttapam was crispy and relatively thin, and it helped pulled the whole dish together nicely. 
-Anchari Lobster [curd rice mousse, sous-vide mango pickle]: Another nicely flavored course.
-Tandoori Monk Fish [alleppey curry, kadumbuttu (rice dumpling)]: Yums!
-Beef Short Ribs Curry [baby turnip, rawa & marrow kofta, baby turnip]: Loved it! If I hadn't known this was beef, I may have thought it was pork belly! The beef was falling apart tender and melts in your mouth type of fatty. Good stuff. Curry was excellent. 
-Garlic Naan: The garlic was very subtle. I loved how it was displayed nicely in a box. Fluffy and nicely baked!
-Saffron Rice: Yesss. It went well with my beef curry. I should start putting herbs in my rice now.
-Saffron Malai Tart [burnt butter kurchan, gold leaf]: HOLY MOLY. THIS DESSERT WAS SUCH AESTHETICS. SO FREAKING BEAUTIFUL, AND ALSO VERY DELICIOUS. NO WORDS.
-Masala Chai Chocolate Pave [mango sorbet, hazelnut chikki]: ALSO VERY DELICIOUS. The spiced chocolate was interesting, compared to the usual non-spiced chocolate.

Overall, the service is fantastic, and the concept is innovative and feels very trendy. I love how this place is perfect for a casual night out with friends, but it can also be a destination for a nice, classy dinner date. I am now so very inspired to play around with spices and fail at recreating these dishes (which I will probably not attempt). I totally loved the cocktail menu, and I would want to try more of these one day! 10/10 would come again!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
From the reviews, looks like the dishes are hit-or-miss here so I picked a few that got good reviews.



---- SMALL PLATES ----

Tuna Bhel:  3.5 stars
Worth trying once. Refreshing take on ceviche.

Potato Tikki:  5 stars
Crispy kale and the flavours in this dish are fantastic.

Chicken 65:  4 stars



---- LARGE PLATES ----

Sea Bass:  4.5 stars
Delicious curry that could almost pass for Thai. Sea bass has really tender flesh.

Beef Short Ribs Curry: 5 stars


---- DESSERTS ----

Saffron Malai Tart:  4 stars
author: Letitia L.

description:
My friend and I both ordered the tasting menu, but ordered different options so we would be able to try the full menu. None of the items were particularly memorable except for the fact that the Lamb Ribs were too salty and the Monk fish was too fishy. 

The drinks were good.

The ambiance is cool, but overall not worth the price.
author: Arika B.

description:
Came here with a girlfriend for a Galentine's dinner. Experience overall was wonderful, but let me preface this by saying this is definitely a "treat yo self" type of place. They were only offering the pre-fixe menu in the evening, which was $90 per person ($55 additional if you added the wine pairings). We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Overall ambiance was clean, modern, and Indian with a twist, so to speak. We noticed overall that the crowd was a bit older  for SOMA, so probably wouldn't be here for a night out. Service was fantastic, and both the hostess and servers were extremely knowledgeable about the menu.

I'm giving this place 4 stars primarily because you spend a lot of money for not a lot of food. Everything was delicious and plated beautifully. We had the lobster and spare rib as our mains. Dessert left something to be desired (it was a tiny piece of Chai chocolate cake). Food has Indian inspirations but is neither here nor there in terms of origin - which I imagine is part of the appeal and creativity. Everything was tasty, albeit tiny. I ordered a "Love Potion" cocktail special they had that night, which was my favorite part of the meal. It was a gorgeous red color with a hint of sage. When it was all said and done we had each walked out spending $140, happy that we treated ourselves for the occasion.

I would to back in future for cocktails or to take a look at their regular menu. Would be curious to see what the portions and pricing are like. But overall, pre-fixe is nice if you want to try a number of flavors and are wanting to be a bit fancy for the evening and celebrate an occasion.
author: Alexa P.

description: Amazing service (would check up every 3 min), quiet ambiance, and innovative foods. A lot of the platters surprisingly made me reminisce on childhood dishes that my mom cooked- chaat, kabobs and even raita. ROOH made Indian food contemporary by introducing Tuna Chaat, Duck Seekh Kabobs and Avocado Raita. I was blown away. I was way too full for dessert, but definitely worth the $$$.
author: Nabiha J.

description:
I've been to this location twice and also to Baar Baar in NYC, having great experiences each time.  This time was a major let down.

The Malabar fish curry had absolutely zero flavor (think broth) and the fish was overcooked.  The naan this time lacked the balance of pillowey and crispy as it previously had - tasting like your average doughy/nothing special naan.  Our first course took ages to come out although we were one of the first guests to arrive at lunch.

This was after traveling all morning from TX and picking Rooh as our first restaurant.

At this point, there are other high end Indian restaurants in SF that are worth my calories.  

Rooh, you let me down.
author: Ish A.

description:
AMAZING!!! Definitely one of my favorite Indian restaurants in SF and Rooh has only been opened for 3 weeks. I can see this restaurant doing really well. I honestly think the appetizers were better then the mains but overall it was pretty tasteful with lots of spices!

Things I ordered/recommend:
- Potato Tikki
- Asparagus Pepper Fry
- Tuna Bhel (MUST GET)
- Rawa Crusted Vegetable Dumplings
- Lambshank Nihari
- Tradiotional Butter Chicken
author: Jenn L.

description:
Great place, quite a bit different than the regular hole in the wall places you get in SF with heavy duty chicken tikka masalas.

Food: Great. We got the tuna bhel (7/10), chicken 65 (8/10), butter chicken (10/10), dal makhani (10/10), lamb shank (7/10)

Oh my the butter chicken was hands down one of the best in the city. Its not overloaded with cream/butter/honey so it has the right amount of masala. The Dal Makhana reminded me of Bhukhara in Delhi - you could smell the burnt coal in the dal which was amazing - they probably slow cook the dal for 24 hours or more. Seems bad that I downed it in less than 2.4 minutes.

The ambience is good - some good music too, and the service was great. They treat you well, and the presentation of the dishes was great. 
the bar seems to be nice as well.

I'd definitely come back here when I want to feel pampered. Although I'll wait for my company stock to vest because that's what the bill will demand at the end of the night!
author: Arjan N.

description:
Rooh is trying way too hard...

It's like that chick who can barely walk in Toms but decides to put on 6 inch stilettos to impress a guy. Only she looks like a baby giraffe on roller skates that rolls her ankle on one of the thousands of potholes in San Francisco. Not that I'm speaking from experience or anything...

It seems Rooh is trying to be the Indian Hakkasan serving "progressive" Indian food in a nightclub atmosphere. Except Rooh was a total miss with most items not translating well on the plate and service was frustratingly amateur for a large restaurant group (http://goodtimesrestaurants.com/). 

I've been to newcomers August 1 Five and Babu Ji (also serve contemporary Indian cuisine) and while they're both not perfect, Rooh was by far theeeee worst of the three. 

I enjoyed my Mango Mule ($13): http://bit.ly/2lYfI1q. Not much mango flavor but it gave me a good buzz. Ugh, that dizzying cocktail menu though: http://bit.ly/2lMvV9m! Having to spin the phuckin paper wheel in the dark and trying to decipher all the letters at different angles was exasperating. 

As for the food:

*Potato Tikki w/ kale + spinach tempura, yogurt mousse, raspberry ($12) - 4 STARS
http://bit.ly/2lrcKPM
A fav of the night, the app was like a potato cake chaat with creamy yogurt and a tangy chutney. The flavors were a bit muted but the textures and flavors were good. 

*Liquid Foie Gras & Chicken Liver Masala Pate w/ pickled shallot, taftan ($16) - 2 STARS
http://bit.ly/2mw1Hpm
This looked and tasted like canned liver, not decadent foie. Gritty and irony. The taftan was good though. 

*Crispy Lamb Ribs w/ apricot & chili marmalade, horseradish cream ($15) - 2.5 STARS
http://bit.ly/2mCTTl5
Really tender with crispy edges but it was severely underseasoned. The accompanying sauces combined tasted like sweet cream.

*Pork Belly w/ tandoor smoked bbq sauce, pickled radish, pork crackling ($15) - 2 STARS
http://bit.ly/2mCNA0O
Like boiled pork chunks (very lean) drowned in a commercial American BBQ sauce. 

*Traditional Butter Chicken w/ makhani, fenugreek, butter powder ($26) - 2 STARS
http://bit.ly/2m2RQdh
Very unappetizing medicinal, bitter aftertaste. This is coming from a fernet drinker. 

*Naan ($8) - 3 STARS 
Standard naan that you can get anywhere else for $2. They gave us the regular naan and charged us $8 for the sampler one. 

*Banana Tarte Tatine w/ palm jaggery caramel, vanilla ice cream, sesame nougat ($10) - 4 STARS 
http://bit.ly/2lqXpi6
Mmmm nothing like hot, sticky...bananas (what you think I was saying?) encased in a flaky crust with a dollop of cold ice cream for a temperature contrast. But, it was really sweet. 

The staff was polite and our server was nice (and doing her best) but service was unbelievably and frustratingly amateur. 

We arrived early for our reservations. We were told our table was not ready and the customers before us were paying their bill. No problem but then they tried to sit us in the bar area. Uhhh, what happened to the table that was paying? We declined the bar area and eventually was seated at a two top...after several parties who arrived after us were seated first (they appeared to be friends of the staff). 

1st round of drinks took nearly 30 minutes. For the 2nd round, I cancelled my order after 25+ minutes of waiting. 

Given the mixed reviews, we wanted to order apps first to gauge how they were before blowing $60+ on two entrees but our server was vehemently insistent that we order EVERYTHING at once. Obviously this strange request is from management but it was irritating going back and forth about it. She finally agreed to let us order apps and see how we feel afterwards. Ten minutes later, all the apps came flying to our table and before we could even take our first bite of food, we were asked again, what we wanted for our entrees. Aye! 

Empty plates weren't cleared so when our shared entree came, there was no room to put it. As they took the entree back to the kitchen, we quickly stacked our empty plates to make room and waited...and waited. The same entree returned 20+ minutes later.

Busboys later tried to remove plates with food on it (even after I told them we're still working on it). They would pass our table several times, look at my empty water glass but wouldn't refill it. I had to chase down someone for a refill. For everyone's sake, please use larger water glasses! 

Trendy, nightclub atmosphere with loud music. Not recommended for a quiet date. 

Beware: parking meters run to 10 pm! 

I usually don't like to give less than 3 stars for new restaurants but at $80-$100 pp, it's hard to overlook so many missteps from an experienced restaurant group. Not to mention ALL the suspect 5 star reviews (20+ have already been filtered) particularly ones about the Michelin star potential are very misleading to paying consumers who are spending their hard earned money here. 

Not cool, Rooh. 

Why not let the food speak for itself? 

Never mind, that's a rhetorical question.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: We had dinner with friends at Rooh last night. Food was fine but nothing was too exciting. Potato tikki donuts were the highlight of the night out of all ten dishes we ordered. Service was all over the place: I could tell our wait staff was trying but she was really struggling. First she took our drink order and had to come back again to confirm. When she showed up with the drinks, she couldn't figure out who ordered what. Main courses took quite a while to come out. The restaurant charged 20% service for group dinner automatically but I have to say the service was disappointing. One of our biggest complaints comes to their serving spoons. We did family style but the serving spoons were a joke. They kept falling into the plate and it gets so gross to touch (see photos). For the price of the restaurant, they should really consider to invest into real serving spoons. Not sure if we will return.
author: K Y.

description:
The Butter Chicken is prepared to perfection. We especially appreciated chefs subtle addition of roux in the preparation. While flour isn't traditionally found in Indian cuisine, the French technique makes this dish exquisite. And a Tikka Gruyere Fondu with an a la carte side addition of Avocado Raita, who would've ever thought that would've worked? BUT it does! 

California + India & France = I'm in!
author: Jim T.

description: One of the best Indian fusion meals I've ever had. Good for vegetarians. Dinging one star for poor service. Forgot to bring out two entrees for 20 mins.
author: Manish J.

description: This restaurant was a wonderful surprise. Not being an Indian food person , the food was amazing. Butter chicken was incredible and I could have eaten a second plate. Highly recommend Rooh for something way out of the ordinary. It was a pleasant surprise.
author: Mark B.

description:
Best contemporary Indian in the bay area. Compared to August 15 and its competitors, Rooh is much better with fusion cocktail(try pink city and you will get a taste of guava with red masala that we get on streets of India) appetizers - favorites are paneer chili and aloo tiki chaat and entries - favorites are paneer pinwheel, black daal and avocado raita. Chef has really experimented with Indian tastes and it has come out amazingly well. 
I have just one complaint and that's dessert. Although I tasted three of them, I hoped they were better but I loved their moong daal baklava which is no more on the menu.
author: Kalgi S.

description: We've been here multiple times. Food is decent and ambience is good. But recently, service has been really bad. Waiters throw a lot of attitude at you. They bring out wrong orders and they claim you ordered wrong. At the end of the day, you want a peaceful meal, especially when it's not insignificant amount of money you pay for the food you get. Improve service or you'll lose loyal customers
author: Madhuri S.

description:
We had a very disappointing and frustrating time eating at Rooh last night. Rooh just opened a few days ago, so perhaps they will sort out their issues in a few months.

We had reservations for dinner at 7pm and were promptly seated. The interior has a very modern hipster vibe and is very tastefully done.  However, the space between our table and the table behind us was much too small - with my chair and the chair of the person sitting behind me practically touching. We had to scoot our chairs uncomfortably close to the table in order to allow other diners and the waitstaff to access the tables next to us. It was very annoying having to eat with my table wedged against my abdomen for most of the night.

Our waitress was very friendly and she apologized profusely and repeatedly throughout the night as our dinner dragged on.

For starters, I ordered the Goan chorizo Scotch egg, and my dining companions had the burrata and chicken malai tikka. The Scotch egg was quite tasty and paired well with our fancy cocktails. I had a Raspberry Shikanji which was quite nice. The appetizers and the cocktails came out pretty quickly and everything was fine so far, except for the annoyance with the chairs.

After we finished up the starters, everything seemed to degenerate. We waited a very long time for the entrees to arrive - about 30 minutes from the time our appetizer plates were cleared until the entrees were served. Our waitress appeared a few times during the wait and apologized for the delay. When the entrees did arrive, one of them was incorrect - and had to be sent back to the kitchen. We received a complimentary order of butter chicken with the chef's apologies - however the person with the incorrect order was vegetarian, so she wasn't able to eat it anyway.

After awkwardly waiting for the messed up order to brought to the table, most of our party decided to start eating, lest everything gets cold. I had the Beef Short ribs curry, which is the most expensive item under the LARGE PLATES section of the menu - it was definitely not a large plate - it was not even a medium plate.  All of the appetizers that we had earlier that were listed as "Small Plates" were larger than this supposedly "Large Plate" short rib. Although entree is titled "Beef Short RIBS curry" - it could not have been more than 1 rib, so calling it short RIBS is misleading.

Although the portion size was very small - it was actually quite tasty. My companions also enjoyed their entrees and wanted some more naan to mop up the sauces, so we ordered another naan for the table.

Meanwhile, the messed up order still hasn't been served, and lone vegetarian in the party was still waiting. Although most of the group waited to start eating, and we ate very slowly, we all finished our entrees and also polished off the complimentary butter chicken before she was served.

About 5 minutes after everyone else finished their entrees, the messed up order was finally served.  She had ordered the Tandoori Portobello, but without parmesan cheese, since she has an aversion to cheese. (The original order was served topped with parmesan). The mushrooms seem to taste OK, but it was a little weird since everyone had already finished eating.

Meanwhile, the extra naan that we ordered still hasn't arrived. Even long after the lone vegetarian finished her messed up order, the naan still hadn't shown up. We had wanted to mop up the curry sauce with the naan, and everything was cold, and the sauces were congealing there was still no naan. Our waitress gave us status updates about our naan every 5 minutes or so, saying that she'll be back with the naan in just a little bit, but still no naan. 

The other waitstaff offered to clear our table a few times, since it appeared that we were done, but we explained each time that we were waiting for a naan to mop up the sauces.

Finally, about 30 minutes after the vegetarian had finished her entree, this elusive naan was finally delivered to the table. The naan was nice and crisp, and the cold curry sauce actually tasted pretty good with the naan.  Even though I had finished about 40 minutes earlier, I was still a little hungry (The single short rib didn't really fill me up) so it tasted pretty good.

We were offered a complimentary dessert because of our ordeal, and we initially wanted to get the Banana Tarte Tatin, but were warned that "it would take awhile" to prepare. We had already been there for more than 2 hours, so we were not in the mood for waiting any longer, so we got a chocolate cake, which was fine, and only took 10 more minutes to arrive.

We finally got out just before 9:30pm, after arriving at 7pm. It was very pricey, very drawn out, and I was still a bit hungry and actually kind of mad by the end of the dinner, hence the 1 star review.  Our waitress was very friendly and apologized several times throughout the dinner, and the food itself tasted pretty good, but the overall experience was terrible.
author: Allen T.

description:
I have never seen another restaurant use prettier teacups and teapots. Simply beautiful, thoughtful interior, top-notch service from the waitstaff. Very classy place for a business lunch. We ordered family-style, and every dish was fantastic and delicate and mouthwatering. There was just a little bit of kick, but nothing was too spicy for me, which I appreciated. 

I would describe the food as Indian-fusion. Very creative!
author: Jan Z.

description:
We went here for a special occasion. We already has a reservation, but we got the table after 15 minutes of wait. We were a bug group of 7 and there wasn't enough place to stand and wait.

Once we got the table, however, everything went super smoothly. The food was very delicious. We got couple appetizers - sev puri, paneer tikka and some asparagus dish. They were all good, the sev puri outstanding. We got paneer pinwheel, jackfruit dumpling and a few meat dishes for main course. The pinwheel has to be reordered, it was so good. The bread and rice were good as well. 

We got 2 bottles of wine for drinks and a couple cocktails. The wine selection is really good. Cocktails were okay. 

For dessert, we got something with mango custard - so good!!
author: Namrata J.

description:
Good meal! Itemized review:
- The straw chairs were very comfortable to sit in. The netting had a lot of give, which was unexpected and pleasant.
- Naan + Chutney sampler was _delicious_. The spicy red, hummus-textured chutney was my favorite.
- The cauliflower appetizer was delicious as well.
- The little duck-cake appetizer was less interesting. The texture was a little crumbly and the flavor a little bland -- as if the chef was not sure whether to really base it on duck-meat or on bread, and the result is an awkward in-between. It did come with a really tasty dash of black marmalade though.
- I had the lamb shank for the main dish, which came in a bed of delicious sauce. The meat was very tender and peeled easily off the bone. It was good, though honestly not among the best lamb shanks I've had -- to compete there, it would've had to be more flavorful or more strongly spiced. This meat was a little mild/unremarkable in flavor. It did not come with any rice, which was probably a good thing -- that would've been too much.
- I had the Greek Fizz soda for a drink, which was all right, though a little too much on the sweet side.
author: John L.

description: Came here for a team lunch as it was nearby and had tons of options for dietary needs. The ambiance is very modern and the colors are bright reflective of the Indian culture. I loved the guava mocktail and the stuffed lentil kulchas. The saffron rice and paneer curry was flavorful. Service was great! Highly recommend this Indian restaurant.
author: Shivani S.

description: *Janice voice* OH. MY. GOD. This is the best place ever. Food was absolutely amazing. Everything was superb, rich, and flavorful. Portion sizes were good too. If you come here and don't order the butter chicken then you missing out. The bread pudding was also a highlight. The drink was a Kerala sour(probably spelt wrong) but was also amazing.
author: Dani G.

description:
We went during happy hours and it was so delicious ! The barman Alex is so nice and knowledgeable, he make such good cocktails with advices and profesionnalism. Unlike the bar's manager who was stressfully and unwelcoming. Only here for spoil the atmosphere.
I recommend this restaurant !
author: Laure C.

description:
Uneven service made up for by creative food and cocktails. It isn't your standard Indian restaurant -- whether you measure it by conventional family restaurant standards or more swanky London upscale Indian food standards. This place definitely has a California twist that is undeniable and does make it stand out.

The goods:
Potato Tikki (5/5) - The kale rendition makes this unique and the flavors all work well together.
Malai Broccoli (4.5/5) - great balance of veggies and flavors
Chicken 65 (4/5) - decent size for a "Small plate" and it was very moist and flavorful
Chai Punch (4/5) - unique presentation in a tea cup and pot. 


The okay:
Asparagus pepper Fry (3/5) - was mostly just asparagus with little added oomph. so if you're looking for a more understated vegetable dish, this is for you
Lamb Ribs (3.5/5) - tasty but they were a little tough and not "fall off the bone" as some people have reviewed. They also took a long time to come
Naan (3/5) - not much special here but it was fine
Pink City (3.5/5) - refreshing but nothing special. wasn't sweet (to me a good thing)

The bar service is great and friendly. They even let you transfer tabs which is rare I find. 

The table/food service while attentive at times was rather uneven. Bar got confused and sent the same drink I had at the bar again to the table. Then they forgot to give us our naan by the end of the meal and we had to ask. Food courses came at pretty uneven rates.

The hiccups were forgivable given how awesome the space and food is but I hope they up their game.
author: Victor W.

description: Ok getting excellent food, service and getting them fast is a myth in most restaurants. Rooh was amazing! The dishes came out at blazing speed from the kitchen and each of them was very meticulously done... and the taste was awesome.. Tried a few of the cocktails, small plates and desserts. Tried all their desserts! AWESOME
author: S P.

description:
Wooh for ROOH!  

Specialty crafted cocktails that are broken down into different flavor profiles to help you choose what you're craving.  This high end cocktail lounge and with indian food is located around the corner from AT&T park and is a .8 mile walk from BART.

This place is often packed to I highly recommend a reservation!  My boyfriend and I came here on our one year anniversary on a Monday night and they could barely squeeze us in somewhere that wasn't the bar!  We were very grateful they did, even though our table wasn't the most ideal in the back on the way to the restroom.  The issue was the hideous wall we were sitting next to, as I personally liked being away from the noise and action.  

We decided to enjoy our evening by ordering one tapas/small dish at a time and judged along the way how much we needed.  Our waiter was very accommodating to our ordering style.  We started with cocktails, I got the Raspberry one that was good but I kept getting seeds stuck in my straw and my boyfriend got the old fashion, which was excellent.  My previous visit here for a drink I got the Chia cocktail out of the tea cup, that I highly recommend.

Our first dish was the chutney sampler.  It comes with three chutneys ranging from sweet to creamy to savory and two pieces of naan cut in half.  There was more chutney than naan and I wish they gave more.  Next we had the Chicken 65, our favorite dish of the night.  It was decent size for a small plate and packed a punch full of flavor and spice which built over time.  Third was the Lamb ribs that literally fell off the bone.  Although they were cooked beautifully it was a dainty portion to split.  At this point we ran out of our first cocktails and I wanted a glass of wine and my boyfriend wanted a beer.  We reminded our waiter twice for a menu to look at for drinks, placed our order of drinks and he had to come back to be reminded of mine.  We didn't receive our drinks for about half an hour after that.  We finished with the tuna dish that was light and very refreshing.  In hindsight we would have ordered in a different order to complement the dishes better but all were tasty.  We received our last drinks after our final dish, which was somewhat frustrating but our waiter apologized and explained it was unacceptable.  With this apology I thought we might see it reflected on our bill, however we were still charged for our overly late and forgotten about drinks.  

All and all the food is excellent however the portion leaves a bit to be desired for the price point.  I'd highly recommend this place for a cocktail and light bites.
author: Stacey C.

description:
ATMOSPHERE
Before we walked in my lady and I thought, oh look, another fancy lookin' place to make us feel rich. We were kindly greeted by someone at the front and then told to go to the bar because we were only there for the overpriced desserts (it's fancy, we understand, so we're not complaining exactly).

Given that this was a Saturday evening and everyone was dressed in nice clothes, I figured that these were a bunch of rich, stuck up folks, but I can't judge based on their appearance, maybe they were there to just have a nice time?

CUSTOMER SERVICE
Hmm. I'm actually having a hard time with this one so that's why I only gave it three stars. If you can't make your customers feel welcomed at least then it's a no-go on the five stars. 

SELECTION
We were so utterly confused with the cocktail menu at first. Being a developer, that cocktail menu was far from intuitive and could have used a lot of improvements. 

Dessert was awesome, but there was only three to choose from in the menu. I don't mind given that this was not your typically priced restaurant. This was some high-class rich folk level. That dessert was good, but wasn't enough to really satisfy my lady and I.

We ended up going to Woodlands afterward to satisfy the remaining food craving that we had.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
So let me start off by saying that the interior is really well done. It really feels uplifting and they took advantage of the high ceilings. 

They were also very accommodating as far as making me drinks with gluten free alcohol. The staff was attentive at first and then it died off a little towards the end of the night. They felt a little under staffed. 

I really enjoyed what we had which was the chutney samplers, the crispy kale and yogurt dish, the tuna, and the lamb. I would say that I was expecting the dishes to be slightly more elevated in flavors. That was a bit disappointing. 

I would also say the meal felt a bit over priced. I know it's in SOMA but I was still expecting a bit more creativity for the price. 

Overall worth trying.
author: Rachel F.

description: Best restaurant in SF hands down! Best food, best cocktails, best wine list and best staff. My go-to place for family dinners, anniversary, date night or even mid-day lunch.
author: Ashley G.

description: Amazing and creative food, even better than the Taj Compton Place which has a Michelin star. The food never disappoints. Really like the lamb shank and milk cake. Just wish the service at the bar were a little bit faster.
author: Aakash P.

description: Had an incredible dining experience here - came here with some coworkers after work on a random weekday. We ordered many menu items and ate family style. The chili paneer & different chutneys were incredible. I practically licked the butter chicken plate; and the aubergine eggplant dish yogurt peanut sauce was amazing. The drinks were the real all star of the meal - we tried every single drink on the menu, and we all loved the unique flavor profiles of each drink. Definitely a dining experience worth trying at least once in San Francisco!
author: Nicole P.

description:
So my wife and I gave this place a second shot after a below average experience the last time. 

We went for lunch on a Friday and were promptly seated. We ordered the Pani Puri, Lamb Keema Paav, and Butter Chicken with Garlic Naan.

Paani Puri - Was pretty decent. 

Lamb Keema Hyderabadi - This dish came with just one small Paav bread. While I understand the restaurant pushing people to order extra bread, serving a dish with such a small piece of bread is embarrassing to be honest. 

Butter Chicken - Big chicken pieces, but the gravy was meh. The dish lacked flavor and seemed more Americanized. 

To add to this, our service was very slow. Took over 15 minutes to even get a beer on the table.

We were indeed looking for fusion Indian style food and wanted to really give this place another try and hoped they were better. But definitely not for lunch :-(
author: Anand V.

description: Great Indian food. Love the curry flavors and the garlic naan is magical. Best Indian in the area.
author: Devin H.

description:
Not worth it. Overpriced naan and small entrees.

Drink menu was well designed.
author: Paul M.

description:
A really great Indian restaurant with a twist. They had more modern types of dishes but definitely keep the Indian flavors. It is a little prices but we went to celebrate a family members' birthday. 

It is a great place for special occasions and you can even have a prefixed party menu. 

Some of the great dishes we had were the assorted papads and crisps, the naan, the potato tikki, chicken 65, burgundy truffle & heirloom tomato. Buttered chicken. Lamb shank and the ribs. The chocolate cake for dessert was incredible.
author: AGawesomeness6 ..

description:
We went to Rooh last night to celebrate my brother in law's birthday. We did the vegetarian tasting menu and overall it was pretty good! Some dishes were delicious and some could use more flavor! 

If you are used to typical, very flavorful Indian food, you are going to find the food a little bland. It's an artistic/embellished take on Indian food and the presentation for all the dishes was stunning. They have a great bar menu and the cocktails were delicious! These were my favorite dishes from the nine course tasting menu:

Potato tikki 
Pani Puri
Asparagus pepper fry
Paneer chili
Liquid egg burji 
Carrot halwa cake 

The service was great but at times it also felt a little chaotic and unorganized however, overall it was a fun experience! I do recommend they add a little more flavor to their dishes and allow people to taste all the delicious and varied flavor Indian cuisine has to offer!!
author: P P.

description:
TL;DR -Good Food, Pathetic Service. Highly Overpriced. First Visit Last Visit.

I often that not try new and different places, being the foodie I am. Seeing Rooh, down the street, I got excited and made it a priority to try it out. Little did I know, I'd be turned off by the pathetic service and cold attitude of our server, Alan B. He was rude, and didn't make us feel welcome at all. Having a party of 6, the table was pretty small which seemed more appropriate for a party of 4 at max. 

The service was damn slow, order was served inaccurately, and servers were inattentive. Lack of courtesy would be under stating it, something that you would expect from a high end dinner place.

Food was great, Dal Makhani was fabulous, just as you would expect it to be made, nothing else otherwise was extra ordinary IMO to justify the price. Tandoori Seasonal Mushrooms was a big big let down.

I was also charged automatic gratuity which would apply to parties of 6. In my opinion, if you want to have a great time at a fancy Indian restaurant, there are a lot of other better options which are more spacious, with great service and warm feeling around downtown such as Amber, Dosa, etc. Don't come here to pay $$$ and have a bad time.
author: Nikhil G.

description:
Solid addition to the indian/new-american lineup of restaurants.

The best way to describe this place is upscale Indian food. Unlike almost all other indian restaurants that are more homey/down to earth, this place is what indian food would be like if you took it to another level. Gone are the tacky porcelain plates you would find at home -
presentation here is king. There are no more paper cups for chai, no more strip mall vibe. This is a classy upscale rendition of indian cuisine.

However, for those of you that watched Chef's Table and saw the episode on Gaggan, you will be sorely disappointed. Don't compare this place to a 3 star michelin restaurant with a genius chef who wants to change the way the world thinks of indian cooking. They serve naan here (a sampler platter if you wanna try them all out) and a variety of different curries and meats (the lamb!). The food itself was not mind blowing, and sometimes it felt that the placement went a little overboard. If you are someone who likes it spicy/large portions, you will find neither here.

Beautiful interior ambiance, good service, and a solid cocktail list round out the experience. To the engineers socially-adept enough to convince a girl to go out with them and to the rich VCs of the valley: this is a spot for you. The rest of us plebes will have to wait for an excuse like a birthday to make it out here.
author: Albert C.

description: Great dinner, but for the second time out of dessert; and at 930 on a Thursday. Seriously, order more food.
author: Si K.

description: So we walked in to the restaurant at 6 PM on Sunday evening. The manager/owner was standing at the door did not greet us. He walked by us many a times and did not bother to greet us. Mind you, the restaurant was literally empty. They would not give us a table, only a high table. They said they were "booked". They could not serve Indian chai for dinner, unfortunately and could not accommodate my vegan husband. We ordered one appetizer and had to leave. It really was a sad experience. At the end I told the hostess to let the manager know I said hello. :)
author: Ruby R.

description: Probably the most inventive cocktails I've ever had. Try the one with the mushroom and the one with the mustard and ghee! Incredible. Really, everything we tried was delicious. You really can't go wrong no matter what you get!
author: Sadie O.

description:
I have been eyeing this place for quite some time now and I am so glad I finally did! The decor is very pleasing and our hostess and the wait staff were great! It was a Monday evening and I did not feel like a cocktail but the menu was so creative I definitely wanted to try something! Our waitress recommended the chai punch and pink city which could both be made without alcohol and they were both great. The pink city is definitely spicy and has a kick, the chai punch is cold (unusual for chai) and served in a very regal teapot! 

For the food we got the chilli paneer, chicken 65 and beef short ribs curry. I really enjoyed the two small plates which were perfect to share and seasoned beautifully! They were modern twists on classic indian bar food dishes which I loved. The curry was great and the meat was buttery and tender, this was my first time eating short ribs though and I think it was personally a miss. 

Overall great experience and I definitely want to come back to try more of the small plates!
author: Rachel N.

description: Tried this restaurant as a recommendation from a friend. Very interesting mixture of spices used to create Indian fusion cuisine. Very reasonable prices and our waiter was excellent as he helped us navigate through the different menu items.
author: Winnie L.

description: I can't say enough good things. The service was impeccable, the ambiance was great and the food was perfection. The somm was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable... but on top of that, extremely friendly and inviting. Couldn't have asked for a better first experience. I look forward to enjoying more meals with business colleagues, friends and family.
author: Patrick F.

description:
This place has been on my must eats for the last few months and I was really looking forward to eating here. However, I must say I was a little disappointed in the taste. 

We were able to order a plethora of dishes to try as we were a group of 6 but only found two dishes that were worth ordering again (chutney sampler and green jackfruit dumplings). The rest although sounded great on paper, failed to throw a punch.
author: Kavitha P.

description:
This is probably my new favorite for fancy, good and authentic North Indian Food in San Francisco.

Drinks : Innovative, yes! I think we walked in from the Alchemist Bar so we rated them as Okay.

Food : 
Must have - Lamb Keema, Potato Tikki (this was amazing, flavors from Delhi and the crispness from Kale giving it a different touch

Service : that was another best part of this dinner! They also poured champagne for us, complimentary on the House! Service was definitely better than Rasa (1 Michelin in Burlingame) 

We have been to the Mumbai's Taj Mahal Palace Hotel for dinner, looking at Rooh's service and food, this place can definitely rank higher than The Taj Mahal Palace's Restaurant! Kudos to the Chef for a great job getting a beautiful platter out for the Indian Cuisine and to the owner of this place for the decor. 

I will definitely be back for their Lunch!
author: Pranamee S.

description: One of the best contemporary Indian places in the Bay Area hands down. We went in for a weekend brunch at around 12:30pm. The hostess seated us right away. The ambience was pretty casual and loved the little details like the peacock pillow, and the electric blue interiors. We ordered the masala omelette and cauliflower 65 for starters. The omelette blew our minds. It was full of flavor and even the toast given with it was so flaky and pastry like . The cauliflower 65 with uthappam was interesting in a good way. For our main course, we ordered the biriyani and paneer makhani. The biriyani was served piping hot in a stoneware vessel with accompanying avocado Raita and jalepeno salan. Loved it . The paneer makhani was so creamy and delightful. In a nutshell, really enjoyed our brunch today. And the team at Rooh is doing a great job.
author: Sruti H.

description: A good choice. Enjoyed the multiple flavors of India. Some of the dishes have a fusion flavor. Lamb, vegetables, potatoes, kale and so on. Great deserts and teas. Fast service. Reasonable prices for the location. A bit noisy and cramped. Apparently busy whenever it is open.
author: Ahmad F.

description:
Had friends raving about this restaurant so gave it a try. The small plates were delicious. We ate the chili paneer and creamed broccoli. The large plates were *very* disappointing. The rawa balls in spinach sauce lacked flavor, spices. The lotus root topping on the balls was cute. The pork that my husband ordered was average. The side of cumin potatoes had a salt mishap but the saffron rice was cooked to perfection. The mango mule and other drinks we had were fine. Our waitress was sweet. The server looked exhausted repeating ingredients when delivering the food. It's a useless touch to have the server say "these are rawa balls in a spinach sauce, topped with lotus root" Hello, I just ordered it and I remember what I ordered. 

Space is cramped. They should look at angling the tables. It's shocking when Indian food is botched up. Are your recipes written down? How are you adding salt to your food, needs calibration. 

Two stars for the delicious small plates & sweet waitress. Won't be back.  Good luck!
author: R R.

description: Rooh is excellent from the first interaction on the phone to the service at the table.  Unparallel.  We have a daughter with many food allergies so I called Rooh to check if they could accommodate her.  Our daughter has allergies to peanuts, tree nuts, eggs, dairy, and wheat.  The manager on the phone said no problem and the kitchen would make sure no cross contamination occurs.  I was skeptical only because most restaurants couldn't do this.  This reservation was to celebrate my wife's birthday, and she loves Indian cuisine.  We arrived, and the manager remembered my phone conversation, read the notes from OpenTable, and had the chef come out and explain that the kitchen created an allergy-free zone as well as a dedicated server just for my daughter's food.  This treatment is beyond our expectations!  After all of this, they remembered my wife's birthday and gave us each free dessert!  The food was amazing.  It's a modern take on Indian cuisine.  The flavors are very pronounced, but not overbearing with heat from the spices.  My daughter had a special melon and tuna salad, Beef rib - rice - veggies and a mint coconut sorbet with strawberry jelly.  She was over the moon.  It was the most flavorful meal she has ever had!  We loved the Paneer Chili Roll, Potato Doughnut Tikki, Traditional Butter Chicken, Lamb Shank, and Lobster.  Yummy.  Thank you so much to the team at Rooh, the service, Chef Sarkar, and the staff.  Amazing, kind, and talented people!  We will be back.   - Frank Mong
author: Frank M.

description:
This is the best fine dine Indian food I've had!! I've been to quite a few expensive Indian restaurants but this one takes the trophy. 
I took my husband here for his birthday and we ordered the chutney sampler and beetroot Murabba for appetizers. The chutneys were good but the naans were amazing. I've never even heard of beetroot murabba, we were very curious and the end result was really good. For main course we got the paneer pinwheel and grain pulao. My husband is a true paneer lover and he is very serious about his paneer (lol) He just loved this dish! even though he was satiated, he kept eating it. I ordered grain pulao and it was pretty amazing, starting from the presentation to taste. They give you a side of peanut chutney and avocado raita which was a good compliment to the pulao. 
For the dessert we got carrot halwa and it was good too! 
TIP: If its a special occasion let the host/hostess know and they will get you a dessert for free :) 

Cocktail menu is pretty interesting. Wine was not really good, I got the rose. I don't think they store their wines well. 
All in all must go place!!
author: Vijeyta S.

description:
At first I was wary about going to yet another fancy Indian restaurant in SF, but I am so glad we decided to celebrate a good friend's birthday at ROOH! 

The space was beautifully decorated, the food was phenomenal, and the service was on point! Our server Trevor was really fantastic! He patiently answered all of our questions about the menu and provided great suggestions. He also made sure to check in on us throughout the meal (without being overbearing). I was impressed by the flavors of the dishes (interesting combinations that truly elevated Indian food) and the attention to detail.  I was also pleased that the restaurant noticed the special note I left on my OpenTable reservation that we were celebrating a friend's birthday. Having been to most of the fancy Indian restaurants in the city, I can say without hesitation that ROOH is my favorite and I cannot wait to come back to try the tasting menu!

Bravo, ROOH! Thanks for a fabulous meal.
author: Alice W.

description:
Wonderful ambience. The hosts welcomes us into progressive Indian cuisine. We were super excited to try relatively new upscale Indian Restaraunt.
Went there with our 8 year old twins.
The hostess was Lovely polite and attentive they got the kids mocktail version of popular cocktails. We ordered Pappad as our family loves it
Followed by food which was a combination of appetizers and entrees. The food came promptly. But the problem is it all came together. We did not have enough space to keep it all on the table
Indian food is all about serving HOT. By the time we got to our entrees they had become cold.
The flavors were just right took us back to the authentic butter chicken dal makhani served in Delhi. The naan was served in a tray the presentation was beautiful but it became dry and cold. We enjoyed the tea and malai tart as desert. Overall good experience good flavors but I will
Not go there again until I really miss Home flavors.
author: Shuchi M.

description: Great fusion Indian food and specialty cocktails in a casual atmosphere. We actually never got to the mains as the appetizers were so good. Lively conversation, innovative cocktails and tasty snacks...makes for a fine evening!
author: Hari J.

description: Hats off the Chef Fujan Sarkar to make our experience truly out of league. It was my wife's birthday and he made sure we get the BEST experience. He came in personally to meet us and explain us the menu items and provided us a surprise dish. The food is the best I have tasted in the Bay area (Indian). The tagline progressively Indian is a natural fit for the restaurant. We ordered a Dahi Puri, Keema hyderabadi which was heavenly, chickpea in poppy seeds (he killed us with this one and i am amazed with the way a bengali modified dish made its way to the menu and fascinated us) and the famous chicken butter. The carrot halwa cake was fantastic as well. I think the service was a bit slow and the server said the portion size was small (no way :) )... thanks Rooh for the awesome experience
author: Anirban S.

description: It's closer to 3.5 but bumping it up to 4 Since the staff has consistently been really great. There's a few dishes that are quite unique since it's Indian fusion And they have several specialty cocktails, personally not a cocktail person but if you are, this would be a fun place to try. The ambience is actually quite nice.
author: Tiff W.

description:
Incredibly good fancy Indian restaurant.
We tried pretty much all of the vegetarian small plates and all of them were brilliant!

Each dish had been gourmetized into something a lot more sophisticated than what its name would suggest. For example the Jhalmuri (which literally means spicy puffed rice and is commonly found street food in Bengal) was more like a rice krispies bar with some exotic toppings and garnishes on it including avocado and a buttermilk sorbet.

Our favorite was definitely the Paneer Chilli which had been converted into some sort puff pastry-type of dish that had a lot of interesting flavors and textures in it.

Extremely innovative food, great service, great ambience... definitely coming back for more!
author: Aditya M.

description: Amazing dining experience. They have a fancy and great twist on Indian food, lovely ambience and delicious cocktails. My favourites were the paneer chili, potato tikki and the dahi Puri. The paneer pinwheel was a great large plate. The chef personally came to ask for feedback on the food and created an off the menu incredible dessert full of goodness for us! Highly recommend this place!
author: Ruchi M.

description:
First the positives, really a beautiful space. Great colors and very inviting. The cocktails are also great. Creative and different, many different ones to choose from, hard to decide!
The food all was good, but not great at least for me. As in the case with many "fusion" places I feel like the core element of the cuisine is often lost. So don't come here for a "curry". (Not that we did) We tried a bunch of different dishes, maybe 8-10. I don't remember. Nothing was bad, but nothing was amazing either, and really the only thing to stick out in my mind was the side potatoes and cumin, this was really nice. Given the price tag, and the food not being better, I doubt we will return. Shame, really nice space. I think for a very nice Indian meal I would rather return to Dosa, they've got all the same things going for them and I find the food to be a lot more exciting.
author: Alex O.

description: The head bartender was amazing. Forgot his name but the dude was legit and very pleasant to talked to. He was the older white gentleman and he can make some good drink. The service in this bar will keep me coming back for more!
author: Lam L.

description:
Went here for lunch with colleagues yesterday, and shared the potato tikki, Cauliflower 65, and vegetarian platter. The potato tikki (which was actually a flash-fried kale and spinach salad) was delicious, the Cauliflower 65 was ok and the vegetarian platter could have been more flavorful. It wasn't bad, but for the money I'd go with August 1 Five or DOSA.

Loved the decor though.
author: Sameer J.

description:
Good place for a date night, where you want to get engulfed in the opulence and not worry too much about the fine taste of food. The food overall is heavily on the sweetish end of the taste spectrum. Indian food has to have bold flavours, and by bold I do not mean spicy, but there is so much you can do with the array of flavours and Rooh failed to impress

(+) Great cocktails. I love the way they have split the cocktails based on tastes (sour, sweet, bitter, salty...). Maybe add an umame category? However I loved the Kerala drink

(+) Asparagus Pepper: only dish which had the correct balance of flavour

(-) Naan with chutneys: all chutneys were overly sweet

(-) Tandoori mushroom entree: It was hardly tandoori. No smoked taste at all. All I could taste was cheese and sugar. No other flavour stood out 

(-) Dahi papdi: Too sweet

(-) Daal: overly creamy


If I do go there, will just get the drinks. Poor experience overall, would not want to go back.
author: Puneet L.

description:
ROOH does Indian fusion well ! The ambience is good and service is also friendly. However, the place is super expensive for the quantity. 

I have been here on a couple of occasions and like the jalmuri bar, asparagus pepper fry, paneer pinwheel (sauce is a little sweet), the chocolate dessert and carrot halwa cake. 

For cocktails i liked their mumbai sharbat and mango mule
author: Arvind M.

description:
Its not usually Im impressed with creativity from an Indian restaurant but ROOH surprised me.

The cocktails are good and really unique..the food is tasty and actually creative. .its yummy fru fru food...which Im all about!

The ambiance is great...its classy and chic but you dont feel like you are going to upset anyone if you drop a fork.. (which you may after a few cocktails)

Go in have a drink and a bite!
author: Anitha C.

description:
Giving it a 4 just because of the apps. Otherwise would have scored a 3

Drinks: city of joy was yummy. wines were good too

Food: The apps were AMAZING. We had the tuna bhel, keema, potati tikki, chicken 65 (this one wasn't AS impressive). Entrees were pretty disappointing. We had the butter chicken and the lamb nihari. The only redeeming part of the second half of the meal was the daal (sooo good we ordered seconds).

Ambiance: really liked the decor

Service: No complaints. Everyone was friendly

PS: im on day 2 and my stomach still hasn't been feeling great post eating here. Not sure if its just really heavy but i have indian food about 3 times a week and never really feel this way.....
author: Laura D.

description:
If you like indian food, you should come here. This place is yummy!

I made dinner reservations for 6:15 on a weeknight and had some time to kill so I came early and checked out their happy hour (4-6pm) decent menu with some good options. I would come next time and have their drinks! Fairly priced. We were deciding between doing the tasting menu or sharing a bunch of plates. I think at the end the pricing came out to be somewhat the same. We ended up ordering a bunch of small and large plates to share. For the most part it was a lovely time and i'm excited to come back! Food and service reviews below. 

Food- 
Happy Hour dish - I had the chutney sampler, the naan garlic bread with the peas/goat cheese was soft, warm, and delicious. It came out with three different types of spread - all amazing. the tomatillo and green mango was my favorite with a bit of spice kick. The avocado/yogurt was also really good as well as the chili & peanut 

Happy Hour dish Prawn sausage  - comes in 3 quantity was also very very good. super flavorful and spices were on point. 

Dinner -

My friends and I decided to share. This place is definitely family style (without the portions being family style if that makes sense) here's what we had: 

Jhalmuri Bar - not what we expected. the texture is pretty hard so I would break it apart first then share. It was the only non creamy dish that we got so it was a nice chance from all the creamy dishes we ordered. 

Malai Broccoli - mix of broccoli, yams, and artichokes. I loved this dish, it was really tasteful and seasoned very nicely! Good portion size to share. (see pics) 

Asparagus Pepper Fry - i liked the asparagus more than the curried cauliflower mousse that came with but nonetheless if you're an asparagus fan, i would highly recommend this. Tender and again seasoned well. 

Kashmiri Lamb Ribs - Nice spice kick and the ribs goes well with the yogurt chutney. A totally shareable dish. 

Panner pinwheel - sauce, amazing. Dip the naan bread over and over. Can't go wrong here. Dish comes in 3 quantity

Tandoori Seasonal Mushrooms - also really nicely displayed! The polenta texture was well done with the parmesan cream froth, accompanied by the truffle imported from France. 

Sea Bass - Really nicely cooked. Presentation was lovely. We could have done it either without the jalapeño salan or with just a small bit. They do put quite a bit over the seabass and i think it overpowers the flavor of the seabass itself.

We also got 2 of the bread samplers, different kinds of naan bread to please everyone. All so good. 

Drinks - 
Chai punch - most common and popular. Comes in a fancy tea cup and tea pot. Don't be fooled though it's not a hot drink. You can also really taste the monkey shoulder. Really good. 

Mistletoe Kisses - as my friend puts it  it's like drinking a bouquet of flowers (lol) it's very light, light fragrance, and floral. Was not sweet at all. Very delicious and would recommend drinking it throughout dinner instead of just for dessert. 

For Dessert we shared te Carrot Halwa Cake - most popular at the restaurant. Texture, taste and presentation was definitely 5 stars. 


Staff/Service - Very attentive. replaced our old places, wiped off any excessive food splatters and food on the table. Very courteous and knowledgeable about the menu. Made some recommendations which we took and were pleased with the dishes we ordered (more so) 

Ambience of the restaurant is very nice. I would definitely want to come again and try their breakfast/brunch menu and tasting menu. It was definitely a little pricey but not totally surprised by how much things cost. I think given the portion sizes, it could have been priced out more fairly but i totally understand. The quality of the food was top notch, food was beautifully presented and displayed. Overall ambience and vibes of the restaurant was really nice. I can definitely see events taking place here. 

Nice decor, friendly staff and they have great seating space indoors (limited space outdoors) I would recommend sitting indoors instead of outdoors to be perfectly honest.

Will be back!
author: Tammy K.

description:
This is my favorite new restaurant in town! 
Things I loved on the menu:
- Liquid Egg Bhurji
- Asparagus Pepper Fry
- Mushroom Polenta Upma

Things I didn't like as much:
- Avocado Jhalmuri (Too crispy)
- Paneer Pinwheel (very standard and not as flavorful)

The ambience is casual chic and I've been told the cocktails are great! I'm a wine drinker so I felt my options were somewhat limited. 

PS: Go for the tasting menu if you can. It's reasonably priced for the number of courses and portion sizes.
author: Shree K.

description:
Terrific experience.  Relaxed ambience, wonderful server and service generally, creative and delicious cuisine.
