We got a chance to meet the owner, she was really sweet to talk to and was making frequent rounds to ensure everyone was having a great time! Highly recommend this place and will definitely return!
author: Rishika M.

description: Officially my new favorite Indian restaurant in SF now. Went here for my anniversary and tried the tasting menu. Everything was fantastic from the food to the service.
author: Zeeshan P.

description: Wow! I loved this place. The staff was very courteous & welcoming, the food was great and the ambiance was interesting! We ordered the Malai Chicken Tikka, Butter Chicken and a couple of drinks. The Malai Chicken Tikka was incredible - the appetizer was definitely better than the main course! Also, in most places, cocktails are a hit or miss for my wife but she LOVED the cocktail here (Delhi 6). Might visit again soon!
author: Sanket K.

description: The drinks were nice (I had the pink city which was spicy but very smooth and just the right amount of buzz without feeling grumpy!). The tuna bhel was delicious - chicken 65 was alright (will not try that again).
author: li s.

description: It's a pretty fancy upscale place which is nice as you don't get to see Indian restaurants like this very often. But on the food front nothing stands out, the food tastes good but nothing brilliant which brings you back, for the price I expect some dishes to be amazing. So you pay up for excellent ambience n nice food but you may get better or equal tasting food somewhere else.
author: Sunil B.

description: Went to ROOH on Mother's Day - it was a treat. Service was superb and the food was excellent. I'd say it's very well done, creative, high end Indian food. The masala omlette was very, very tasty as was just about everything else. The decor is fabulous and the drinks are also dynamite. Can't wait to be back!
author: sophia k.

description: We came here thinking maybe it would be just another new hipster fusion restaurant with little soul, but came away impressed with our experience.  The space is colorful and modern, and filled with light.  I feel that it adds character to this SOMA block...this area has changed dramatically over the years and while I miss some of the old establishments, Rooh brings a touch of flavor and culture with a fun vibe.  From the greeting and service to the bill, attention to detail was paid.  We had the pork belly, tandoori mushrooms and beef short ribs curry.  We also tried a Banaras Sour (Bloom gin, basil, cucumber, chartreuse) and Pink City (Plantation rum, guava, Indian chili, masala spices) cocktails, both of which were served up, yet still refreshing and not too heavy.  We also ordered the mustard old fashioned, which was much more stiff, in a good way, but tasted basically like an old fashioned, garnished with a crispy, candied orange wheel.  The kitchen sent out an amuse bouche shortly after we ordered - I couldn't tell you what exactly was in it, but it was delightful.  All the dishes we ordered were beautifully presented, and full of authentic flavor.  The manager was also very kind and attentive.  We can't wait to come back.
author: Selene W.

description: The food is awesome and it is a perfect place for a relaxed dinner. The food is great the desserts are out of the world. Gajjar Halwa a must eat
author: Geeta M.

description: The food here is different yet amazing. It's also a great place for HH. I will be going back soon =)
author: Lady R.

description: Best customer service by FAR! Amazing mango mule and decadent desserts! ROOH will NOT disappoint!
author: Sonika P.

description: Overall, we had a great dinner here. We had the potato tikki, chicken 65, chili paneer, pork belly and vegetable dumplings. We loved everything except the pork belly. The pork belly had a nice texture and was good, but lacked the creativity of the other dishes. The textures and flavors of the potato tikki were standout. My only complaint about our dining experience is that all of the plates came out at about the same time. Halfway through our meal, our food was cold. I would definitely come back, but would ask that our dishes be better spaced.
author: Shannon S.

description: Dinner at Rooh ; after long time enjoyed great Indian  Fusion food ; though normally i avoid fusion and prefer Authentic recipes, Rooh chef has rocked it out... full of subtle and bold favors ... capped it with Awesome carrot galea cake and amazing india tea ..,check it out
author: Ramesh D.

description: Sitting at a high table we had the most enjoyable meal. We asked our waitress to just bring us the best of the house and we got it. Everything was delicious and the service was great. Paired with cocktails from a very well thought out cocktail list we truly enjoyed our meal.
author: Gijs V.

description: I instantly knew the moment I tried the cauliflower dumplings that this would be the meal I would crave forever. (The cauliflower is actually not the main flavor if you don't like that veggie.). The tuna small plate is another that I described to my friends later on. The meal was incredible, memorable, and the experience was high end. It's the kind of restaurant experience that makes you realize you're and adult and you now dine instead of simply eating.
author: M L.
